conclusion: Analyze the forces involved in the system when all blocks are accelerating together.
A horizontal force F is applied to block B; blocks A, B, C, and D move together with a common acceleration a.
Net force on the system is F; total mass is 4m; using Newton's second law, F = (4m)a.
Acceleration a of the blocks is a = F/(4m).
Consider blocks A, B, and C as a single system to determine the force exerted by the spring.
Applying Newton's second law to blocks A, B, and C: F - F_s = 3ma.
Substitute a into the spring force equation: F_s = F - 3m(F/4m).
Block D must have the same acceleration a as the other blocks.
Using Newton's second law for block D: f = ma.
Substitute a into the friction force equation: f = m(F/4m) = F/4.
The static friction force acting on block D is f = F/4.
